title: How to Make a Frankie Roll with Tortillas

steps.headline: Microwave the potatoes.
steps.description: Take 2 white Idaho potatoes and cut them in half; this helps them cook more quickly. Use the "Potato" setting in the microwave to heat up the potato for 10 minutes (if you don't have this setting, try the methods in How to Cook a Potato in the Microwave). To tell if they are done, test with a knife; if you're able to cut through the potato without hearing a crunching or squeaking noise, it means that it is cooked well.

steps.headline: Mash the potatoes.
steps.description: After heating the potatoes, peel the skin and mash the potatoes using a potato masher.

steps.headline: Add spices.
steps.description: Add salt to taste (usually about 1/2 teaspoon but you can do more or less) and 1/2 a teaspoon of chili powder.

steps.headline: Mix a cup of finely chopped onions into the potato mix.
Add 1/2 a cup of green peas into the potato mix.
Add 1/2 a cup of grated paneer (Indian cottage cheese) into the potato mix, if desired.
steps.description: This step is optional if you don’t have access to the ingredient.

steps.headline: Add cheese.
steps.description: Add 3/4 cup of sharp cheddar cheese into the potato mix.

steps.headline: Heat a pan on the stove at medium heat.
steps.description: Put 1/2 teaspoon of butter on the pan. Once the butter has melted, place the tortilla on the pan and heat it up.

steps.headline: Add the potato mix.
steps.description: While the tortilla is heating up on the pan, take 1.5 tablespoons of the potato mix and place it at the center of the tortilla is a straight line.

steps.headline: Roll up the tortilla and toast it until it’s a light brown color and a little crunchy.
steps.description: The amount of time you cook it depends on how crispy you want it.

steps.headline: Repeat.
steps.description: If there is any potato mix left, put another tortilla on the pan, add the rest of the stuffing, and toast it.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve your frankie rolls on a plate with tomato ketchup. Enjoy!

text: Making the Potato Mix Microwave the potatoes. Take 2 white Idaho potatoes and cut them in half; this helps them cook more quickly. Use the "Potato" setting in the microwave to heat up the potato for 10 minutes (if you don't have this setting, try the methods in How to Cook a Potato in the Microwave). To tell if they are done, test with a knife; if you're able to cut through the potato without hearing a crunching or squeaking noise, it means that it is cooked well. Mash the potatoes. After heating the potatoes, peel the skin and mash the potatoes using a potato masher. Add spices. Add salt to taste (usually about 1/2 teaspoon but you can do more or less) and 1/2 a teaspoon of chili powder. Mix a cup of finely chopped onions into the potato mix.  Add 1/2 a cup of green peas into the potato mix.  Add 1/2 a cup of grated paneer (Indian cottage cheese) into the potato mix, if desired. This step is optional if you don’t have access to the ingredient. Add cheese. Add 3/4 cup of sharp cheddar cheese into the potato mix. Making the Roll Heat a pan on the stove at medium heat. Put 1/2 teaspoon of butter on the pan. Once the butter has melted, place the tortilla on the pan and heat it up. Add the potato mix. While the tortilla is heating up on the pan, take 1.5 tablespoons of the potato mix and place it at the center of the tortilla is a straight line. Roll up the tortilla and toast it until it’s a light brown color and a little crunchy. The amount of time you cook it depends on how crispy you want it. Repeat. If there is any potato mix left, put another tortilla on the pan, add the rest of the stuffing, and toast it. Serve. Serve your frankie rolls on a plate with tomato ketchup. Enjoy!
